other.description: Each time an enemy unit targets this model, after that unit has finished making its attacks, this model can either shoot as if it were your Shooting phase or fight as if it were the Fight phase.
other.name: Frenzy

other.description: If this model is equipped with two Helbrute fists, those weapons have the [TWIN-LINKED] ability.
other.name: Helbrute Fists

datasheets.fluff: Helbrutes are walking engines of destruction, their psychotic occupants kept alive in a state of agony and insanity. These infernal sarcophagi are fitted with a variety of powerful armaments to blast enemy armour open from afar, and cruel appendages with which to hack and crush with enormous strength at close quarters.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: missile launcher; multi-melta; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Helbrute
wargear: For each Helbrute fist this model is equipped with, it can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 heavy flamer
This model’s missile launcher can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Helbrute fist ◦ 1 Helbrute hammer ◦ 1 power scourge
This model’s multi-melta can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Helbrute plasma cannon ◦ 1 twin autocannon ◦ 1 twin heavy bolter ◦ 1 twin lascannon ◦ 1 Helbrute fist

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Bloodied Terror

other.description: At the start of the battle, select one unit from your opponent’s army to be this model’s sworn foe. Each time this model makes an attack that targets that sworn foe, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll. If, at the end of the battle, that sworn foe has not been destroyed, this model is destroyed.
other.name: Oath to Khorne

composition: 1 World Eaters Daemon Prince with Wings
datasheets.fluff: Desperate eagerness to kill in Khorne’s name is a trait shared by all World Eaters Daemon Princes. The blessing of a pair of powerful, hooked wings is the perfect aid. Descending from the skies at the speed of bullets, they slam into their enemies, roaring oaths to Khorne and swearing the doom of those before them.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: infernal cannon; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Daemon Prince with Wings

stats.name: World Eaters Daemon Prince with Wings

wargear: None

other.description: At the start of your Command phase, this model regains 1 lost wound.
other.name: Self Repair

datasheets.fluff: World Eaters Rhinos are well-adapted for battlefield transportation. Though corrupted by the warp and encrusted with dried blood, they remain as reliable as ever, safely carrying their passengers over fire-swept terrain. Many of these vehicles are festooned with blades, and have machine spirits just as bloodthirsty as their occupants.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: combi-bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Rhino
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 World Eaters Infantry models. It cannot transport Eightbound, Exalted Eightbound or Terminator models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 additional combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move and roll two D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Swooping Predator

datasheets.fluff: Like vast, draconic predators of myth, Heldrakes sweep suddenly out of the sky. These airborne Daemon Engines excel at intercepting the enemy’s aerial assets, tearing them from the air and incinerating their crew. Once their dominance of the sky is complete, they turn their claws and weapons against prey on the ground.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Hades autocannon; Heldrake claws.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Heldrake
wargear: This model’s Hades autocannon can be replaced with 1 baleflamer.

other.description: Each time this model makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, its hellforged weapons have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
other.name: Devastating Assault

other.description: While a friendly World Eaters Infantry unit is within 6" of this model, models in that unit have a 5+ invulnerable save, unless they already have an invulnerable save, in which case they have a 4+ invulnerable save.
other.name: Infernal Fortitude (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: The trail of blood a World Eater must leave behind him to become a Daemon Prince is so vast that it could submerge entire worlds. For their deeds, the Lord of Rage has rewarded them with infernal immortality and might. In battle, Daemon Princes lead their warbands in devastating assaults, striding unharmed through enemy attacks.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: infernal cannon; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Daemon Prince
wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time you make a Charge roll for this model, if one or more of the targets of that charge are below their Starting Strength, add 2 to that roll. Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: The Scent of Blood

datasheets.fluff: Maulerfiends stalk the battlefield like immense hunting beasts. With the enemy in sight, these huge Daemon Engines thunder forward, even scaling defensive walls in their eagerness to get at their prey. Once amongst the foe, they slaughter anything in reach with their huge talons, crushing jaws and lashing tendrils.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: lasher tendrils; Maulerfiend fists.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Maulerfiend
wargear: This model’s lasher tendrils can be replaced with 2 magma cutters.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has finished making its attacks, if one or more of those attacks scored a hit against an enemy Infantry unit, that Infantry unit must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Furious Onslaught

datasheets.fluff: Forgefiends are fused with enormous rotary cannons that fire fist-sized phosphor shells, or else with ancient artefact ordnance perverted to vomit ectoplasma from the beasts’ own innards. With such weaponry they mow down masses of enemy troops and blast glowing craters into the toughest opposition.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 Hades autocannons; 1 Forgefiend jaws.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Forgefiend
wargear: This model’s 2 Hades autocannons can be replaced with 2 ectoplasma cannons.
This model’s Forgefiend jaws can be replaced with 1 ectoplasma cannon and 1 Forgefiend claws.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time a ranged attack made by this model targets an enemy Infantry unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
other.name: Destructor

datasheets.fluff: Many of these ancient war engines have unleashed destruction on battlefields dating back to the Horus Heresy. Their rapid-firing guns scythe apart infantry and light vehicles as they storm into battle.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Predator autocannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Predator Destructor
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 2 heavy bolters ◦ 2 lascannons

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, re-roll a Damage roll of 1.
other.name: Annihilator

datasheets.fluff: These tanks’ machine spirits are likened to the animus of a stalking hunter. They unleash searing beams from their lascannons and enter front-line brawls to crack open bunkers housing the craven foe.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Predator twin lascannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Predator Annihilator
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 2 heavy bolters ◦ 2 lascannons

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can be moved over friendly Monster and Vehicle models as if they were not there. This model can move over terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.
other.name: Scuttling Walker

datasheets.fluff: Defilers are Daemon Engines possessed by abominable entities. Towering creations that stomp across the battlefield on piston-driven legs, their clanking claws are easily capable of cutting a Space Marine in half. Foes are not safe at a distance either, as Defilers’ monstrous heavy weapons are just as deadly at long range.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Defiler cannon; reaper autocannon; twin heavy flamer; Defiler claws.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Defiler
wargear: This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon
This model’s reaper autocannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 twin heavy bolter ◦ 1 twin lascannon
This model’s twin heavy flamer can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 havoc launcher ◦ 1 Defiler scourge

damaged.description: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: At the start of your Charge phase, select one Wrathful Presence ability (see left). Until the start of your next Charge phase, this model has that ability.
other.name: Wrathful Presence

other.description: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if this model is destroyed, you can use a triple 6 from that roll to use this ability. If you do, this model is no longer destroyed and is placed into Reserves with its full wounds remaining.
other.name: Reborn in Blood

abilities.description: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this model, each time a Charge roll is made for that unit, add 1 to the roll.
abilities.name: Glorious Bloodletting (Aura)

abilities.description: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
abilities.name: Righteous Slaughter (Aura)

abilities.description: While a friendly World Eaters unit that is below its Starting Strength is within 6" of this model, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit. For the purposes of this ability, if a unit has a Starting Strength of 1, it is considered to be below its Starting Strength while it has lost one or more wounds.
abilities.name: Infectious Rage (Aura)

special.description: If this model is in your army, it must be your Warlord.
special.name: Supreme Commander

datasheets.fluff: Angron is rage given immortal form. An engine of destruction, he possesses the strength to tear apart Imperial bastions with his bare hands and stop Titans in their tracks. Armed with the sword Samni’arius and the axe Spinegrinder, he is capable of carving his way through entire armies of foes in a whirlwind of apocalyptic bloodshed.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Samni’arius and Spinegrinder.
datasheets.name: Angron
wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time a unit disembarks from this model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.
other.name: Assault Ramp

datasheets.fluff: World Eaters Land Raiders are massive armoured transports bristling with heavy armaments and seething with a killer spirit. Strung with trophies taken from those slain by the savage warriors the tanks carry to the front line, Land Raiders are the gore-encrusted spear-tip of many World Eaters assaults.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 soulshatter lascannons; twin heavy bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Land Raider
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 World Eaters Infantry models. Each Eightbound, Exalted Eightbound and Terminator model takes up the space of 2 models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon

damaged.description: While this model has 1-8 wounds remaining, subtract 4 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, for each enemy unit destroyed by this model in the previous battle round, you can add 1 to or subtract 1 from one of the dice rolled (each dice can only be modified in this way once, and a dice cannot be modified below 1 or above 6).
other.name: Blessed Slaughter

datasheets.fluff: Lords of Skulls are insane, monolithic creations fuelled by boiling blood and dedicated to slaughtering in the name of Khorne. They plough through the enemy’s ranks, crushing infantry beneath their tracks, hacking tanks into kindling with sweeps of their cleaver and hurling brazen projectiles or burning ichor at the survivors.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: gorestorm cannon; Hades gatling cannon; great cleaver of Khorne.
datasheets.name: Khorne Lord of Skulls
wargear: This model’s Hades gatling cannon can be replaced with 1 skullhurler.
This model’s gorestorm cannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 daemongore cannon ◦ 1 ichor cannon

other.description: Each time an enemy unit within 6" of this unit is selected to Fall Back, that unit must take a Leadership test. If that test is failed, that unit must Remain Stationary this phase instead.
other.name: Overwhelming Wrath (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Some Eightbound reach a level of apotheosis when the soul of the World Eater they once were becomes one with the eight daemons sharing their physical form. This only makes them more dangerous. With no internal competition for control over their body, the Exalted Eightbound possess a purer kind of rage that is directed at their foes.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Eightbound eviscerator; Eightbound chainfist.
datasheets.name: Exalted Eightbound
wargear: The Exalted Eightbound Champion’s Eightbound eviscerator and Eightbound chainfist can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 paired Eightbound chainfists ◦ 1 heavy chainglaive

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if this unit is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if this unit is Below Half-strength.
other.name: Bloody Fury

datasheets.fluff: Clad in hulking, corrupted Terminator plate, each of these murderous brutes is akin to a walking tank. Their powerful array of heavy firepower and brutal melee weapons can tear through elite squads.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: combi-bolter; accursed weapon.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Terminator Squad
wargear: Any number of models can each have their combi-bolter replaced with 1 combi-weapon.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 World Eaters Terminator’s combi-bolter can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 heavy flamer ◦ 1 reaper autocannon
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model’s accursed weapon can be replaced with 1 chainfist.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model’s combi-bolter and accursed weapon can be replaced with 1 paired accursed weapons.
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 3 models can each have their accursed weapon replaced with 1 power fist.

other.description: At the start of each player’s Command phase, one model in this unit regains up to D3 lost wounds.
other.name: Regenerating Monstrosities

datasheets.fluff: Becoming a Chaos Spawn is the dark fate of many upon the Path to Glory. Wracked with the endless gifts of the Dark Gods, they are mutated mounds of muscle, writhing pseudopods, slathering maws and far more. Chaos Spawn are herded towards their terrified foes, advancing in loping runs, seeking only to tear, crush and consume.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: hideous mutations.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Chaos Spawn
wargear: None

other.description: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.
other.name: Objective Ravaged

wargear.description: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can re-roll one of the dice.
wargear.name: Icon of Khorne

composition: 1 Jakhal Pack Leader, 1 Dishonoured and 8 Jakhals
datasheets.fluff: Jakhals are amongst the strongest and most bloodthirsty of all the mortal followers of the World Eaters, and seek to emulate their gore-crazed masters in every way they can. When sent into battle, they enter the fray with wild abandon, hacking and slashing with their chain weapons in the hope of earning the favour of their lords.
datasheets.loadout: or:
datasheets.name: Jakhals
wargear: Any number of Dishonoured models can each have their Dishonoured chainblades replaced with 1 skullsmasher.
For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Jakhal can be equipped with 1 icon of Khorne.
For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Jakhal’s Jakhal chainblades can be replaced with 1 mauler chainblade.

other.description: At the start of the battle, before any moves are made using the Scouts ability, you can select up to two friendly World Eaters Infantry units within 6" of this model. Until the end of the battle, all models in the selected units have the Scouts 6" ability.
other.name: Road of Eight Bloody Steps

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Counter-attacks

datasheets.fluff: A master of swift raiding, devastating counter-attacks and hit-and-run strategies, Lord Invocatus seeks to shed more blood and take more skulls for Khorne by moving from one war zone to another at great speed, leading his hosts as they smash into enemy battle lines while mounted upon his mighty Juggernaut, Khal’guruth.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Eightbound ■ Exalted Eightbound ■ Khorne Berzerkers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bolt pistol; Coward’s Bane, Juggernaut’s bladed horn.
datasheets.name: Lord Invocatus
wargear: None

other.description: At the end of your Charge phase, if this model is leading a unit and that unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you must take a Leadership test for this model. If that test is failed, one Bodyguard model of your choice in that unit is destroyed.
other.name: The Betrayer

other.description: If this model is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. It can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
other.name: Berzerker Frenzy

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1 and re-roll a Wound roll of 1.
other.name: Legendary Killer

datasheets.fluff: Khârn is a raging storm of slaughter, the embodiment of the eightfold path of Khorne. As he sprints into battle, his bellowed war cries boom from the vox-grille of his helm. Khârn’s mantra – ‘Kill! Maim! Burn!’ – has become infamous across the Imperium, a terrifying harbinger of the carnage to come.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Khorne Berzerkers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Khârn’s plasma pistol; Gorechild.
datasheets.name: Khârn the Betrayer
wargear: None

other.description: Each time this model’s unit ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model and roll one D6: on a 2-3, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 4-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Bloody Stampede

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, you can re-roll any or all of the following rolls made for that unit: Advance rolls; Charge rolls; Blood Surge rolls (see Khorne Berzerkers).
other.name: Aggressive Advance

datasheets.fluff: Lords of the World Eaters have spent countless mortal lifetimes leading their warriors. Some have achieved such feats of greatness that their bloody patron has seen fit to reward them with a Juggernaut. These savage daemonic steeds crush all in their path when they stampede forward.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Eightbound ■ Exalted Eightbound ■ Khorne Berzerkers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plasma pistol; exalted chainblade; Juggernaut’s bladed horn.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Lord on Juggernaut
wargear: None

other.description: Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a Character unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
other.name: Murderous Swing

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.
other.name: Trophy Taker

datasheets.fluff: Masters of Executions are corrupted axemen who single-mindedly seek out the greatest enemy champions to claim their skulls for Khorne, bellowing a fatal decree before crashing forward and hacking through armour, flesh and bone.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Khorne Berzerkers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bolt pistol; axe of dismemberment.
datasheets.name: World Eaters Master of Executions
wargear: None

other.description: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If that attack targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.
other.name: Beacons of Rage (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Virtually unrecognisable from the World Eaters they once were, Eightbound are Heretic Astartes whose form is possessed by eight daemons of Khorne. As a result they have incredible strength and savagery far in excess of others in their warband. Carrying all manner of chain weapons, they can rip apart any who stand against them.
datasheets.loadout: The Eightbound Champion model is equipped with: lacerators.
datasheets.name: Eightbound
wargear: The Eightbound Champion’s lacerators can be replaced with 1 heavy chainglaive.

other.description: Each time an enemy unit is selected to shoot, after that unit has finished making its attacks, if any models from this unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, this unit can make a Blood Surge move. To do so, roll one D6: this unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but this unit must finish that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding Aircraft). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. A unit cannot make a Blood Surge move while it is Battle-shocked.
other.name: Blood Surge

wargear.description: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can re-roll one of the dice.
wargear.name: Icon of Khorne

wargear.description: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can re-roll one of the dice.
wargear.name: Icon of Khorne

datasheets.fluff: Berzerkers of Khorne relish their role as the Blood God’s sacred destroyers, and are fanatical in the extreme. The warp-fuelled anger of these psychopathic warriors drives them into an endless frenzy of action. Those who face them in battle disappear under a rain of heavy blows, each potent enough to shear limbs and shatter shields.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt pistol; Berzerker chainblade.
datasheets.name: Khorne Berzerkers
wargear: 1 model can be equipped with 1 icon of Khorne.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Khorne Berzerker’s Berzerker chainblade can be replaced with 1 Khornate eviscerator.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Khorne Berzerker’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.
The Khorne Berzerker Champion’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.

enhancements.description: World Eaters model only. You can select the bearer’s unit for the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for  0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.
enhancements.name: Battle-lust

enhancements.description: World Eaters model only. Add 1 to the Attacks and Damage characteristics of melee weapons equipped by the bearer. Each time the bearer ends a Charge move, roll one D3; until the end of the turn, add the result of that roll to the Attacks and Damage characteristics of those melee weapons instead.
enhancements.name: Berzerker Glaive

enhancements.description: World Eaters model only. Each time an attack  is allocated to the bearer, halve the Damage characteristic of that attack.
enhancements.name: Helm of Brazen Ire

enhancements.description: World Eaters model only. Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, before doing anything else, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, discard all of the dice from that roll and make a new Blessings of Khorne roll. This new roll does not count as a re-roll, so any rules that enable you to re-roll or manipulate individual dice (e.g. Icon of Khorne) can still be used.
enhancements.name: Favoured of Khorne

stratagems.effect:
In your opponent’s next
Command phase, each enemy unit within
6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock
test. If the unit taking that test is Below
Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test.
Enemy units affected by this Stratagem
do not need to take any other Battle-shock
tests in the same phase.
stratagems.fluff:
Those who witness the massacres
inflicted by the World Eaters flee to avoid
being the next victims.
stratagems.name: GORY MASSACRE
stratagems.target:
One World Eaters unit from
your army that made a Charge move this
turn and destroyed one or more enemy
units this phase.

stratagems.effect:
Make a Blessings of Khorne
roll. You can use the results of this roll
to activate one Blessing of Khorne.
That Blessing of Khorne does not count
towards your maximum number of
activated Blessings of Khorne, but all
other rules for Blessings of Khorne apply.
stratagems.fluff:
When blood spills, the blessings of the
Blood God are bountiful.
stratagems.name: FOR THE BLOOD GOD!
stratagems.when:
Fight phase, just after a World
Eaters unit from your army destroys an
enemy unit.

stratagems.effect:
That objective marker remains
under your control, even if you have
no models within range of it, until your
opponent controls it at the start or end of
any turn.
stratagems.fluff:
The blood of Khorne’s devoted warriors
is still blood, and when the battleground
runs red, it is still a worthy addition to the
Blood God’s domain.
stratagems.name: BLOOD OFFERING
stratagems.target:
One World Eaters unit from
your army that was just destroyed
while it was within range of an objective
marker you controlled. You can use this
Stratagem on that unit even though it was
just destroyed.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, if your
unit Advances, do not make an Advance
roll for it. Instead, until the end of the
phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic
of models in your unit.
stratagems.fluff:
Those who fight for Khorne are driven
to even greater depths of rage, surging
towards the foe in a barely controlled tide.
stratagems.name: APOPLECTIC FRENZY
stratagems.target:
One World Eaters unit from
your army that has not been selected to
move this phase.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase,
each time a model in your unit makes a
melee attack that targets a Character,
Monster or Vehicle unit, add 1 to the
Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff:
Khorne rewards those who test their might
against the strongest foes, blessing the
greatest warriors with his favour.
stratagems.name: FOR THE SKULL THRONE!
stratagems.target:
One World Eaters unit from
your army that has not been selected to
fight this phase.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, each
time an attack targets your unit, subtract
1 from the Damage characteristic of
that attack.
stratagems.fluff:
Khorne cares not from whence the blood
flows, so long as it flows, and mere flesh
wounds will not stay the wrath of the
World Eaters.
stratagems.name: KHORNE CARES NOT…
stratagems.target:
One World Eaters unit from
your army that was selected as the
target of one or more of that enemy
unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when:
Fight phase, just after an enemy
unit has selected its targets.
